ReunionWithFlirty.synopsis: Lakrissa has been resuced from Moonrise by the player and is reunuined with her closest friend, Alfira.
ReunionWithFlirty.how_to_trigger: - Free Lakrissa from MOO and have her return to Haven.loadlevel SCL_Main_Aoe debugbook > act two setup > tiefling path> go to region > act 2 > haven > after checkpointoe prisonersreturn > teleport S_DEN_Tiefling_010- Talk to Lakrissa or Alfira in Haven once they are together.

Bard.synopsis: Alfira has seen her friends, people she considered family, dragged screaming into the nigh. She is upset and only just holding it together. She asks the player to save the prisoners in Moonrise.
Bard.how_to_trigger:
Talk to Alfira in Haven (thanks captain obvious) !
----
loadlevel SCL_Main_A
goto -66 ; 141

AD_WithFlirty.synopsis: This occurs after alfira and lakrissa have their reunion scene in last light (player has rescued lakrissa from moonrise). Lakrissa and Alfira are being cute and concenered for each other.
AD_WithFlirty.how_to_trigger: Lakrissa returns to Haven from Moonrise and stands with Lakrissa.

ReunionWithFlirty_1.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_1.text: You're here. You're all right - how?
ReunionWithFlirty_1.context: NodeContext: her friend, who she thought was dead, is safe and well. Astonished, grateful

ReunionWithFlirty_20.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_20.text: We're 'two tiefling queens', remember? I couldn't leave my favourite bard without her partner in crime.
ReunionWithFlirty_20.context: NodeContext: alfira thought lakrissa dead - lakrissa is enjoying seeing alfira's face and is being playful and cheeky

ReunionWithFlirty_22.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_22.text: I did have some help from an old friend though.
ReunionWithFlirty_22.context: NodeContext: reference to player, grateful and playful

ReunionWithFlirty_16.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_16.context: NodeContext: still astonished, trying to figure out how player managed to save lakrissa

ReunionWithFlirty_31.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_31.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

ReunionWithFlirty_26.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_26.text: If it was anyone else, I'd be sceptical - but you? You've more than earned the title.

ReunionWithFlirty_5.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_5.text: I was in Moonrise and I just happened to run into her.

ReunionWithFlirty_21.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_21.text: Don't play coy - you could have left us behind but you didn't.
ReunionWithFlirty_21.context: NodeContext: stern but full of gratitude - wants the player to know they are appreciated

ReunionWithFlirty_19.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_19.text: Killing everyone who got in my way.

ReunionWithFlirty_0.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_0.text: I'm sorry it came to that. But if it was you or them, I'd pick you every time.
ReunionWithFlirty_0.context: NodeContext: grateful - knows player had to hurt people to save her friend.

ReunionWithFlirty_15.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_15.text: You should have seen them. They were brave but also terrifying - in a good way.
ReunionWithFlirty_15.context: NodeContext: discussing player - impressed. Speaking to alfira

ReunionWithFlirty_6.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_6.text: They've done half the Harpers' job for them already.
ReunionWithFlirty_6.context: NodeContext: discussing player, impressed - speaking to alfira but talking about player

ReunionWithFlirty_11.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_11.text: I never thought I'd see... well, anyone, again.
ReunionWithFlirty_11.context: InternalNodeContext: NEEDS REWARDNodeContext: Delighted and grateful

ReunionWithFlirty_23.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_23.text: Thank you - a thousand times, thank you. One last favour? Take this off my hands - it suits you better.

ReunionWithFlirty_2.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_2.text: In ballads they'd call you 'talented' and 'courageous'.

ReunionWithFlirty_8.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_8.context: NodeContext: lakrissa talking about the player - cheeky and flirty

ReunionWithFlirty_12.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_12.context: NodeContext: lakrissa called the player good looking, alfira is pretending to be shocked and admonishing but is also smiling

ReunionWithFlirty_30.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_30.context: NodeContext: lakrissa talking about the player - cheeky and flirty

ReunionWithFlirty_25.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_25.text: I'm a rogue - breaking and entering is kind of my thing.

ReunionWithFlirty_14.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_14.text: Tactics, planning and, when needed, brute force.

ReunionWithFlirty_32.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_32.text: Then I'm glad you're on our side.

ReunionWithFlirty_7.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_7.text: I'd tell you, but that would spoil the song I'm writing about it.

ReunionWithFlirty_13.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_13.text: Fingers-crossed I'll hear it some day.

ReunionWithFlirty_28.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_28.text: Don't thank me; I had help from a higher power.

ReunionWithFlirty_18.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_18.text: Well, they're not the ones standing here, are they?

ReunionWithFlirty_17.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_17.text: If it got in my way I killed it.

ReunionWithFlirty_4.speaker: Player
ReunionWithFlirty_4.text: With the help of nature's resilience, cunning and fury.

ReunionWithFlirty_9.speaker: Alfira
ReunionWithFlirty_9.text: The druids back in the grove could have learned a thing or two from you.

ReunionWithFlirty_27.speaker: Lakrissa
ReunionWithFlirty_27.text: Of course. How could I leave my sidekick without her partner in crime?
ReunionWithFlirty_27.context: NodeContext: alfira thought lakrissa dead - lakrissa is enjoying seeing alfira's face and is being playful and cheeky

Bard_9.speaker: Alfira
Bard_9.text: When I'm sure it's safe, I'll see about rounding people up to follow the light.

Bard_28.speaker: Alfira
Bard_28.text: Everyone else might welcome you with open arms, but stay the hells away from me you lute-smashing arsehole.

Bard_50.speaker: Alfira
Bard_50.text: Our group grows smaller and smaller. We've lost many, but we have you to thank for the ones who survived.
Bard_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Trying to be grateful but still sounding a bit sad

Bard_31.speaker: Alfira
Bard_31.text: How did you do it? How did you get them out of that hellspit?

Bard_138.speaker: Player
Bard_138.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

Bard_73.speaker: Alfira
Bard_73.text: And your damn well good at it. Thank you - for everything.
Bard_73.context: NodeContext: grateful but a touch sad

Bard_16.speaker: Alfira
Bard_16.text: Then I'm glad we were lucky enough to meet you.

Bard_104.speaker: Player
Bard_104.text: You should be grateful I managed to save anyone at all.

Bard_15.speaker: Alfira
Bard_15.text: I am! Sorry - that came out wrong. Thank you - I know you did everything you could.
Bard_15.context: NodeContext: embarrassed - trying to find the right words

Bard_5.speaker: Alfira
Bard_5.text: It's a sad day to be giving this, but here.
Bard_5.context: InternalNodeContext: NEEDS REWARDNodeContext: Trying to be grateful but still sounding a bit sad

Bard_53.speaker: Alfira
Bard_53.text: The others should be in Baldur's Gate: safe, happy. To die like they did... they didn't deserve it.
Bard_53.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Upset. Just barely holding it together.

Bard_59.speaker: Alfira
Bard_59.text: First cultists nearly murder us, and now we have a traitor on the inside? Can't we trust anyone?
Bard_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: frustrated and tired of being scared

Bard_126.speaker: Player
Bard_126.text: Just focus on getting through this.

Bard_127.speaker: Alfira
Bard_127.context: NodeContext: frustrated sigh but trying to rally herself

Bard_111.speaker: Alfira
Bard_111.text: I know - you've been there for us every step of the way. It's just all a bit much sometimes, you know?
Bard_111.context: NodeContext: relieved, trying to rally herself

Bard_121.speaker: Alfira
Bard_121.text: You're truly unpleasant sometimes, you know? Don't know why I bother.
Bard_121.context: NodeContext: More sad and disappointed than offended

Bard_71.speaker: Player
Bard_71.text: This anger you feel? This fear? Use it. Don't give in to it.

Bard_35.speaker: Alfira
Bard_35.text: My teacher always said emotions are to be felt - not feared.
Bard_35.context: NodeContext: Sad smile at the mention of your beloved teacher

Bard_115.speaker: Alfira
Bard_115.text: You're right. We can't give in - not now. Thank you.

Bard_27.speaker: Player
Bard_27.text: You think a few shadows could beat me?

Bard_36.speaker: Player
Bard_36.text: I'm glad you made it too, it's one hell of a curse.

Bard_61.speaker: Alfira
Bard_61.text: It wasn't the curse that did us in.
Bard_61.context: NodeContext: Smile dropping. Horror entering her voice

Bard_109.speaker: Player
Bard_109.text: I see some familiar faces, but where's everyone else?

Bard_105.speaker: Alfira
Bard_105.text: We were ambushed out in the darkness - by cultists. We surrendered, but that wasn't enough for them.

Bard_11.speaker: Alfira
Bard_11.text: They lined us up like dogs. Asharak was with the kids, telling them it was gonna be all right.

Bard_22.speaker: Alfira
Bard_22.text: Maybe that's why they picked him. Told him to kneel...

Bard_125.speaker: Alfira
Bard_125.text: They took his eyes first. Then his tongue.

Bard_132.speaker: Alfira
Bard_132.text: Rolan, of all people, saved us.

Bard_32.speaker: Alfira
Bard_32.text: He said he stayed in the grove because of you, and I'm damn glad of it. Without him... well, none of us would be here.

Bard_103.speaker: Player
Bard_103.text: I know - Rolan isn't happy with me.

Bard_37.speaker: Alfira
Bard_37.text: Can you blame him? His brother and sister are gone. He's... dealing with it as best he can. We all are.
Bard_37.context: NodeContext: worried for rolan. She's not chiding the player, merely trying to explain

Bard_136.speaker: Alfira
Bard_136.text: How do you do it? How do you keep going?
Bard_136.context: NodeContext: Lost. Looking for guidance, for reassurance.

Bard_145.speaker: Player
Bard_145.text: Just take it one step at a time.

Bard_39.speaker: Alfira
Bard_39.text: You make it sound so easy - but I'll try.

Bard_57.speaker: Player
Bard_57.text: I'll let you know when I figure it out.

Bard_23.speaker: Alfira
Bard_23.text: We're in the same boat, then? That's... somewhat of a comfort.
Bard_23.context: NodeContext: Sad smile but trying to end on a nice note

Bard_91.speaker: Alfira
Bard_91.text: You've done so much for us already, but I have to ask - the others might still be out there.

Bard_95.speaker: Alfira
Bard_95.text: If they're not dead, they're in Moonrise. And gods have mercy on anyone in that hellspit.

Bard_77.speaker: Player
Bard_77.text: I'll do everything in my power to save them - you have my most solemn vow.

Bard_49.speaker: Alfira
Bard_49.text: Thank you. If anyone can manage it, you can.

Bard_24.speaker: Player
Bard_24.text: I'm sure they're fine. Probably being held for questioning.

Bard_43.speaker: Alfira
Bard_43.text: Maybe. Sorry, I shouldn't have said anything. You've enough on your plate.

Bard_1.speaker: Alfira
Bard_1.text: Just be careful out there, all right? I can't handle anyone else dying.

Bard_144.speaker: Player
Bard_144.text: I cannot help - I have far greater evils to conquer. But your friends have survived worse - I am sure they will be fine.

Bard_74.speaker: Player
Bard_74.text: I imagine the cultists are torturing them right now.

Bard_13.speaker: Alfira
Bard_13.text: Why would you say something like that? What is wrong with you? Actually - never mind.

Bard_29.speaker: Player
Bard_29.text: Danger is my life - I wouldn't change it for the world.

Bard_110.speaker: Alfira
Bard_110.text: You're made of sterner stuff than me then.
Bard_110.context: NodeContext: Sad smile but trying to end on a nice note

Bard_0.speaker: Player
Bard_0.text: 'When the night is dark, stars shine brightest.' So keep on shining. It's going to be all right.

Bard_38.speaker: Alfira
Bard_38.text: 'Heart's Requiem', right? The hero survives a war and rebuilds her life - stronger than ever. A tale worth remembering - especially now.
Bard_38.context: NodeContext: Small laugh. a touch of delight among the grief

Bard_46.speaker: Player
Bard_46.text: Only the strong survive. You want to live? Focus on yourself.

Bard_102.speaker: Alfira
Bard_102.text: ...If you say so. But not everyone is as strong as you are.

Bard_142.speaker: Player
Bard_142.text: A strong weapon-arm and a bit of luck. That's all you need.

Bard_41.speaker: Player
Bard_41.text: I take what I'm due and I don't look back.

Bard_117.speaker: Alfira
Bard_117.text: That sounds quite freeing - but I don't have that option, I'm afraid.

Bard_141.speaker: Player
Bard_141.text: To linger in the past is to condemn our future. Focus on the here and now.

Bard_123.speaker: Player
Bard_123.text: It helps to remember what is at stake - I fight for nature, for balance. I fight for life itself.

Bard_20.speaker: Player
Bard_20.text: Danger is my life - there is no greater thrill for me than the hunt.

Bard_112.speaker: Player
Bard_112.text: I don't complain constantly. It's very annoying.

Bard_47.speaker: Alfira
Bard_47.text: ...Never mind, then. Just - just leave me be.

Bard_65.speaker: Player
Bard_65.text: If he hadn't listened to me, maybe his brother and sister would still be here.

Bard_44.speaker: Alfira
Bard_44.text: Don't say that. When I think of what would have happened if Cal and Lia weren't there...
Bard_44.context: NodeContext: worried for rolan, cal and lia

Bard_120.speaker: Alfira
Bard_120.text: Yes. He shielded me and the kids while his brother and sister rushed the cultists.
Bard_120.context: NodeContext: Still horrified but also admiring what cal, lia and rolan did.

Bard_62.speaker: Alfira
Bard_62.text: Cal and Lia were dragged away, along with the others. Rolan isn't... taking it so well. None of us, to be honest.

Bard_2.speaker: Alfira
Bard_2.text: I don't feel lucky. I feel... I feel like I'm at the end of my rope.
Bard_2.context: NodeContext: Lost. Grieving. Looking for guidance, for reassurance.

Bard_83.speaker: Alfira
Bard_83.text: It just... it just never stops.

Bard_113.speaker: Alfira
Bard_113.text: Which...? Back in the grove, he ran drills with the kids. Wooden swords and the like. That seems like a lifetime ago now.

Bard_55.speaker: Alfira
Bard_55.text: Which...? He was on the quiet side, but had a heart of gold. Back in the grove, he'd kept an eye on the kids. Gods, that feels like a lifetime ago.

Bard_21.speaker: Alfira
Bard_21.text: Some of us fought back - or tried to. But it was hopeless.
Bard_21.context: NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

Bard_122.speaker: Alfira
Bard_122.text: All I could do was run.
Bard_122.context: NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

Bard_12.speaker: Alfira
Bard_12.text: That means a lot, coming from you. You always seem to take everything in your stride.
Bard_12.context: NodeContext: warmth but little bit of grief at the end

Bard_68.speaker: Alfira
Bard_68.text: It was that or get dragged to Moonrise.

Bard_107.speaker: Alfira
Bard_107.text: I know what I am and what I'm not - and I'm not ashamed of running. No matter what you think.

Bard_108.speaker: Player
Bard_108.text: What did the cultists do to the others?

Bard_128.speaker: Alfira
Bard_128.text: I don't know. It just... happened so quickly.

Bard_85.speaker: Player
Bard_85.text: Only fools fight an ambush. Better to live and strike another day - preferably to the neck.

Bard_34.speaker: Player
Bard_34.text: Wandering into the darkness was a stupid idea.

Bard_70.speaker: Alfira
Bard_70.text: And I regret it with every breath.

Bard_84.speaker: Alfira
Bard_84.text: I had to watch my friends, people who can barely hold a sword, try to fight a pack of murderous zealots.
Bard_84.context: NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

Bard_92.speaker: Player
Bard_92.text: I've seen a lot of nasty ambushes in my time - but that sounds among the worst. I'm sorry.

Bard_56.speaker: Alfira
Bard_56.text: They lined us up like dogs. Ikaron was with the kids, telling them it was gonna be all right.

Bard_101.speaker: Alfira
Bard_101.text: They lined us up like dogs. Someone told them to rot in the Nine Hells, that we weren't going anywhere.

Bard_88.speaker: Alfira
Bard_88.text: You're all right! Thank goodness, I was worried they'd got you too.
Bard_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing upNodeContext: Relieved. Trying to be cheerful but you're upset, and just holding it together.

Bard_78.speaker: Player
Bard_78.text: I heard what happened - that people were taken to Moonrise.

Bard_67.speaker: Alfira
Bard_67.text: I keep replaying it... over and over in my head.
Bard_67.context: NodeContext: horrified - remembering how scared she was

Bard_129.speaker: Player
Bard_129.text: How about you? How are you holding up?

Bard_94.speaker: Alfira
Bard_94.context: NodeContext: Trying to put on a brave face but you are NOT all right.

Bard_139.speaker: Alfira
Bard_139.text: I still can't believe it. The cultists. The screams...
Bard_139.context: NodeContext: Hurt. Thinking back on how terrified she was

Bard_118.speaker: Player
Bard_118.text: Of course I am. As if there was any doubt.

Bard_134.speaker: Alfira
Bard_134.text: I'm afraid doubt is all I know these days.
Bard_134.context: NodeContext: Trying to put on a brave face but you are NOT all right.

Bard_93.speaker: Alfira
Bard_93.text: You're back! Is... is everything all right?
Bard_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing up NodeContext: Surprise and worry

Bard_42.speaker: Alfira
Bard_42.text: Damn it, no! Once we left that bloody grove, everything was supposed to be all right! We were supposed to be safe.

Bard_130.speaker: Player
Bard_130.text: I'm sorry, but the others? They didn't make it.

Bard_3.speaker: Alfira
Bard_3.text: I knew it. The moment you came through that door I just knew.
Bard_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closing eyes, grief-stricken. Every word a loss.NodeContext: Closing eyes. Deep breathe. Mourful and heartbroken.

Bard_63.speaker: Alfira
Bard_63.text: They were good people - they deserved to die old and happy. Not in the hands of monsters.
Bard_63.context: NodeContext: Upset but trying to be sincere and grateful at the end

Bard_18.speaker: Alfira
Bard_18.text: But thank you - I'm sure you did what you could.

Bard_97.speaker: Alfira
Bard_97.text: That Flaming Fist seemed kind. I keep looking at everyone and wonder whose side they're really on...

Bard_106.speaker: Alfira
Bard_106.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Sincere and heartfelt

Bard_119.speaker: Alfira
Bard_119.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Mad at player, they either upset you or were kind of an ass to you

Bard_124.speaker: Alfira
Bard_124.text: With all this darkness, I'd forgotten what light, true blazing light, felt like. Thank you - we needed a bit of hope.

Bard_131.speaker: Alfira
Bard_131.text: You actually did it - you rescued them from Moonrise. How?
Bard_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: full of gratitude

Bard_79.speaker: Player
Bard_79.text: By doing what I do best - being a hero.

Bard_40.speaker: Alfira
Bard_40.text: If it was anyone else, I'd be sceptical - but you? You've more than earned the title of hero.
Bard_40.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard_75.speaker: Alfira
Bard_75.text: By the time we get to the city, I'm gonna have an entire catalogue of songs about you.
Bard_75.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard_45.speaker: Alfira
Bard_45.text: It's not much, but here - you deserve it.

Bard_135.speaker: Player
Bard_135.text: Killing everyone who got in my way.

Bard_116.speaker: Alfira
Bard_116.text: I'm sorry it came to that. But if it was you or them, I'd pick you every time.

Bard_30.speaker: Alfira
Bard_30.text: I believe in ballads they call that 'talent' and 'courage'.
Bard_30.context: NodeContext: grateful and a little flirty

Bard_143.speaker: Alfira
Bard_143.text: I'm glad it was you who walked through that door. Thank you.
Bard_143.context: CinematicNodeContext: StandingNodeContext: Kindness and appreciation

AD_WithFlirty_0.speaker: Alfira
AD_WithFlirty_0.text: Can I get you anything? A drink? A bite to eat?

AD_WithFlirty_7.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty_7.context: NodeContext: smiling but a bit stern, doesn't want alfira worrying about her

AD_WithFlirty_10.speaker: Alfira
AD_WithFlirty_10.context: NodeContext: little bashful, knows she's being protective

AD_WithFlirty_1.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty_1.text: Anything happen while I was away?
AD_WithFlirty_1.context: NodeContext: trying to make convo but she's actually worried for alfira

AD_WithFlirty_4.speaker: Alfira
AD_WithFlirty_4.text: Too much. I can't wait for things to just be... quiet.
AD_WithFlirty_4.context: NodeContext: little bit tired and down but trying not to sound it.

AD_WithFlirty_6.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty_6.text: It'll be quiet in the city. We'll have a little house, maybe a garden?
AD_WithFlirty_6.context: NodeContext: sincere and heartfelt - trying to make alfira smile

AD_WithFlirty_8.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty_8.text: Why are you smiling at me?
AD_WithFlirty_8.context: NodeContext: smile in her voice, alfira keeps looking at lakrissa and smiling

AD_WithFlirty_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_WithFlirty_3.context: NodeContext: a little bashful at being caught smiling

AD_WithFlirty_2.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty_2.context: NodeContext: playful, you absolutely don't believe alfira but you're happy to act like you do

AD_WithFlirty_9.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_WithFlirty_9.text: How about you? You all right?

AD_WithFlirty_11.speaker: Alfira
AD_WithFlirty_11.context: NodeContext: alfira doesn't feel like she has the right to complain about anything so she keeps quiet
